author: Janinder Rana
comment: Too buggy.. Crashes often. Ameture effort of app development

author: Alex Nguyen
comment: I have a Samsung Galaxy Note 5 and it crashed.DO NOT GET
title: Crashed

author: Will Partridge
comment: Unfortunately it crashes on opening - Moto G2 running 6.0 Marshmallow

author: Andras LOHF
comment: Still wish there was a way to get rid of that banner ad.
title: Great app

author: Thomas Higgins
comment: This app is the only metronome app I've found that attempts to incorporate material design, so props to the dev for that. It works very well, and I find it especially nice that it doesn't require any stupid permissions. The only issue I've found is the notification doesn't work as intended, but that's a rather small issue. Good job!

reply.author: Developer Dunn Apps
reply.content: Thanks for giving some feedback.  We are excited that you like the app!  I will be out of office for the next week so expect me to look into the issue soon.

title: Solid app, just one issue

author: Jacob Burnette
comment: But I can't get it to work on my Moto 360. I can adjust the tempo but not get it to start vibrating at the tempo I set.

reply.author: Developer Dunn Apps
reply.content: We also have noticed the issue.  Expect an update soon.

title: It's very good on the phone!

author: Jayden Rodriguez
comment: If all you're looking for is a simple metronome with some barebones Material Design influence, you'll be happy, maybe. That said, it's missing a lot before it can call itself really good. There are no options for time signatures outside of "X/4". You can put whatever value you want in X and for BPM -- this should translate to the lower time signature value, as well. Also, the "instrument sounds" are just different pitched electronic beats. That bummed me out. :(

reply.author: Developer Dunn Apps
reply.content: Thanks for the reply.  We have gotten the instrument sounds to work but at a very laggy rate.  We will try to add it back soon.

title: Gets a job done.

author: Tyler Boel
comment: Love the app hate the person who made it.

reply.author: Developer Dunn Apps
reply.content: Thank you for your input.  We value your response.

title: Love it

author: Scott Kurtz
comment: Settings bug fixed quickly. Thanks. However. Now the alternate sounds do not work. I select woodblock and the electronic sound still plays. I would also suggest putting a menu button on the right hand side of the title bar, (as shown in the screenshots) which is the design standard for Material. Many phones do not have a menu button these days.

reply.author: Developer Dunn Apps
reply.content:
Update:
I just pushed out an update that tries to override the hardware menu button.  Working on making the sounds better now because they all are electronic.

title: Force closes

author: Matthew Bess
comment: Clean UI and nice simple metronome.
title: Does its job.

comment: Very nice material design, but please add a tap-tempo system. Thanks!
title: Tap-tempo system
